; MacSHAPA Open Database; ; The following file contains a smoke test for the open database lexer.;; While it contains examples of all legal tokens, it is not a legal database; file, and thus the parser is guaranteed to choke on it.  On the other hand,; if we only apply the lexer to it, this file should not generate any errors; or warnings.( setf macshapa-db '( |this is a nominal| |a_pred_name| "a quote string" ))"this is a text quote string.  It contains an embedded new line, and a pair of embedded \"double quotes\""1 -1 3.14159 -3.14159 .1 1. ""TRUE FALSE;  now a long string to test the string extention function."0123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789"ALIGNMENTS>CELLS>COLUMN-WIDTH>FORMAL-ARG-LIST>GROUPS>HARD-PREC>HEADER>IMPORT-FORMAT-LISTS>IMPORT-PRODUCTION-LIST>INSERT-ACTIONS>IS-SHOWN>IS-TRACED>NAME>OFFSET>ONSET>PATTERN>PREDICATE-DEFINITIONS>PROGRAM-ACTIONS>QUERY>SHAPA-PANE-VARS>SPREADSHEET-VARIABLE-DECLARATIONS>SPREADSHEET-VARIABLE-DEFINITIONS>   ;;;; this is and odd comment added for colorSYSTEM>TEXT>TIME>TYPE>USER>VAL>VAR>VARIABLE-LENGTH>VERSION>VOCAB>NONE-SUCH><<FLOAT>><<INTEGER>><<MATRIX>><<NOMINAL>><<PREDICATE>><<TEXT>><<NONE-SUCH>>
